text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Sunday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- United States proposes to host Netanyahu-Arafat summit.
- Three soldiers killed in Friday clashes.
- Temple Mount unrest leaves three Palestinians dead.
- Soldier wounded in mistaken identity shooting in Lebanon.
- Army chief Amnon Shahak warns of more terror attacks.
- Shahak says there doubts whether it's possible to carry out security arrangements built on coordination with Palestinian police.

- Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu tells U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher: I'm ready to accelerate the negotiations with the Palestinian Authority. U.S.: Speed up the evacuation of Hebron.
- Military commentator Zeev Schiff: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat interested in "controlled tension" in territories.
- Israeli army considered evacuating Joseph's Tomb in Nablus; the plan was cancelled under pressure from cabinet ministers of the National Religious Party.
- Netanyahu: The tunnel will remain open forever. Arafat: Closure -- a condition for a meeting.
- Rabbi Ovadia Yosef says now is the time to unite in an emergency unity government.
- Labour party tries to convince Shas to join no-confidence vote in government.
